verses.verse: Then answered <S%H6030><s%> <S%H8799><s%> Zophar <S%H6691><s%> the Naamathite <S%H5284><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%>,

Should not the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of words <S%H1697><s%> be answered <S%H6030><s%> <S%H8735><s%>? and should a man <S%H376><s%> full of talk <S%H8193><s%> be justified <S%H6663><s%> <S%H8799><s%> ?

Should thy lies <S%H907><s%> make <S%H2790><s%> men <S%H4962><s%> hold their peace <S%H2790><s%> <S%H8686><s%>? and when thou mockest <S%H3932><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, shall no man make thee ashamed <S%H3637><s%> <S%H8688><s%> ?
For thou hast said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, My doctrine <S%H3948><s%> is pure <S%H2134><s%>, and I am clean <S%H1249><s%> in thine eyes <S%H5869><s%>.
But <S%H199><s%> oh that <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8799><s%> 'Elohim <S%H433><s%> would speak <S%H1696><s%> <S%H8763><s%>, and open <S%H6605><s%> <S%H8799><s%> his lips <S%H8193><s%> against thee;

And that he would shew <S%H5046><s%> <S%H8686><s%> thee the secrets <S%H8587><s%> of wisdom <S%H2451><s%>, that they are double <S%H3718><s%> to that which is <S%H8454><s%> ! Know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8798><s%> therefore that 'Elohim <S%H433><s%> exacteth <S%H5382><s%> <S%H8686><s%> of thee less than thine iniquity <S%H5771><s%> deserveth.

Canst thou by searching <S%H2714><s%> find out <S%H4672><s%> <S%H8799><s%> 'Elohim <S%H433><s%>? canst thou find <S%H4672><s%> <S%H8799><s%> out 'El SHaddai <S%H7706><s%> unto perfection <S%H8503><s%> ?
It is as high <S%H1363><s%> as heaven <S%H8064><s%>; what canst thou do <S%H6466><s%> <S%H8799><s%>? deeper <S%H6013><s%> than SH'ol <S%H7585><s%>; what canst thou know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8799><s%> ?
The measure <S%H4055><s%> thereof is longer <S%H752><s%> than the earth <S%H776><s%>, and broader <S%H7342><s%> than the sea <S%H3220><s%>.
If he cut off <S%H2498><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and shut up <S%H5462><s%> <S%H8686><s%>, or gather together <S%H6950><s%> <S%H8686><s%>, then who can hinder <S%H7725><s%> <S%H8686><s%> him?

For he knoweth <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8804><s%> vain <S%H7723><s%> men <S%H4962><s%>: he seeth <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8799><s%> wickedness <S%H205><s%> also; will he not then consider <S%H995><s%> <S%H8709><s%> it ?

For vain <S%H5014><s%> <S%H8803><s%> man <S%H376><s%> would be wise <S%H3823><s%> <S%H8735><s%>, though man <S%H120><s%> be born <S%H3205><s%> <S%H8735><s%> like a wild ass's <S%H6501><s%> colt <S%H5895><s%>.
If thou prepare <S%H3559><s%> <S%H8689><s%> thine heart <S%H3820><s%>, and stretch <S%H6566><s%> <S%H8804><s%> out thine hands <S%H3709><s%> toward him;

If iniquity <S%H205><s%> be in thine hand <S%H3027><s%>, put it far away <S%H7368><s%> <S%H8685><s%>, and let not wickedness <S%H5766><s%> dwell <S%H7931><s%> <S%H8686><s%> in thy tabernacles <S%H168><s%>.

For then shalt thou lift up <S%H5375><s%> <S%H8799><s%> thy face <S%H6440><s%> without spot <S%H3971><s%>; yea, thou shalt be stedfast <S%H3332><s%> <S%H8716><s%>, and shalt not fear <S%H3372><s%> <S%H8799><s%>:
Because thou shalt forget <S%H7911><s%> <S%H8799><s%> thy misery <S%H5999><s%>, and remember <S%H2142><s%> <S%H8799><s%> it as waters <S%H4325><s%> that pass away <S%H5674><s%> <S%H8804><s%>:

And thine age <S%H2465><s%> shall be clearer <S%H6965><s%> <S%H8799><s%> than the noonday <S%H6672><s%>; thou shalt shine forth <S%H5774><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, thou shalt be as the morning <S%H1242><s%>.

And thou shalt be secure <S%H982><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, because there is <S%H3426><s%> hope <S%H8615><s%>; yea, thou shalt dig <S%H2658><s%> <S%H8804><s%> about thee, and thou shalt take thy rest <S%H7901><s%> <S%H8799><s%> in safety <S%H983><s%>.

Also thou shalt lie down <S%H7257><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, and none shall make thee afraid <S%H2729><s%> <S%H8688><s%>; yea, many <S%H7227><s%> shall make suit <S%H2470><s%> <S%H8765><s%> unto thee <S%H6440><s%>.

But the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> shall fail <S%H3615><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and they shall not escape <S%H6><s%> <S%H8804><s%> <S%H4498><s%>, and their hope <S%H8615><s%> shall be as the giving up <S%H4646><s%> of the ghost <S%H5315><s%>.
